New Records: Devon Conway broke Martin Guptill's 88-ball record for the fastest 50-overs World Cup century by a New Zealander, bringing his up in just 83 balls.
Rachin Ravindra became the country's youngest centurion in a global tournament at 23.
Key Match Events: Matt Henry's 3 for 48 and Mitchell Santner's 2 for 37 kept England in check in the first half of the match.
Devon Conway and Rachin Ravindra put on an unbroken 273-run stand, the highest partnership in the tournament's history.
Post-Match Reflections: New Zealand's victory provided them ample satisfaction, especially as a revenge for the final of the 2019 World Cup.
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's total of 282 for 9 was the highest score in the match.
Others: The match was played in Ahmedabad, India, and was the first match of the 2023 ICC Cricket World Cup.
